sen.j: 富国強兵（ふこくきょうへい）とは、国家の経済を発展させて軍事力の増強を促す政策をいう。
sen.e: Fukoku kyohei refers to a policy that makes state economics grow and encourages reinforcement of military forces.

sen.j: 中国では、春秋戦国時代に諸侯の国が行った政策を「富国強兵」といい、『戦国策』秦策に用例が見える。
sen.e: In China, a policy which was carried out in lords' countries at the Spring and Autumn period and the Warring States period was called "Fukoku kyohei ", and the examples could be seen in "Sengoku (warlike period) plan".

sen.j: この時代には各国が諸子百家と呼ばれる思想家たちから人材を登用し、騎馬戦術やチャリオットなどの新兵器を導入して軍事改革を行った。
sen.e: In this period each countries appointed thinkers called Shoshi-hyakka (general term of scholars and schools in China), and they introduced new weapons such as Cavalry Operations and chariots, and conducted military reforms.

sen.j: 日本で明治政府の国策の基本を指す。
sen.e: It is a basic national policy of the Meiji government in Japan.

sen.j: 江戸時代の鎖国が原因で欧米列強に国力で大きな差をつけられ、これが安政五カ国条約という新国家を後々まで苦しめる結果となった。
sen.e: Japan, which fell far behind the Western powers due to the national isolation policy in the Edo era, found itself, as a result, heavily burdened under the Ansei Five-Power Treaties, which continued to agonize the nation until long after its fresh start as a renewed nation.

sen.j: これを教訓とした日本は、地租改正や殖産興業で経済力をつけ（＝富国）、徴兵制や軍制改革により軍備を増強（＝強兵）して、列強に追いつくことにより条約改正と国家の保全を目指した。
sen.e: Learning from such lessons, Japan aimed to materialize revision of the treaties and improvement of national security by strengthening its economic power with land-tax reform and encouragement of industries (= to be a rich country), and military power with the conscription system and reformation of the military system (=to be a powerful army) to be equal with other great powers.

sen.e: Learning a lesson from this, Japan aimed to revise the treaties and improve national security by strengthening its economic power with land-tax reform and encouragement of industries (national enrichment), and military power with the conscription system and reformation of the military system (strengthening of the military) to catch up with other great powers.
